item.title: Report E-2023040621
item.description:
Report E-2023040621

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-30T15:08:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-11
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal XDM contacted ERTS to report (8) 5-gallon plastic pails containing UN1814 Potassium Hydroxide 45% were discovered leaking due to improper loading, releasing an unknown amount of the product to the dock floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor for clean up. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released from (2) 5-gallon plastic jugs to a 2â€™ x 2' area of the concrete dock floor. The jugs caps were cracked due to them falling over after the pallet collapsed. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All material was collected and containerized into (2) 55-gallon plastic drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0956 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSC. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN3266 Cir Kleen No. 265 was released from a 55-gallon plastic drum. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3112327. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a damaged/fault cap. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and cleanup debris was collected into a 95-gallon poly over pack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023020195
item.description:
Report X-2023020195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-29T21:08:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-26
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 26, 2023 at approximately 04:00 AM CDT a CN mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve cap of rail car # GBRX 703550 (Load / UN 1987 / Class 3 / PG II / Alcohols N.O.S.) while performing an inbound train inspection at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, Iowa. The railcar was isolated, all required notifications made. CN Response Team responded to the location from Gary, Indiana. The cause of release is determined to be due to debris or an object trapped in the bottom outlet valve preventing a complete seal of the valve seat allowing product to fill and leak out of the improperly secured bottom outlet valve securement cap (BOV cap was not fully tightened. The BOV cap was tightened approximately 1/2 turn which stopped the leak. The BOV handle was then cycled to the open and closed position 5 times to free any possible obstruction from the valve seat. The BOV cap was completely removed and observed for any additional leakage for 10 minutes. There was no further indication of leakage and the BOV cap was re-applied utilizing a 36" pipe wrench. The exterior of the railcar was decontaminated, then released onto destination.

THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XDM called in to report a 1-gallon spill of UN3264 Poni Acid (AFCO 5380) from a 55-gallon plastic drum caused by the previous terminal loading metal drums on top of this plastic drums causing them to be crushed and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to leaking bung caps. The product was transferred from the damaged drum into a new 55 gallon poly closed top. The damaged drum was then placed into a 95 gallon poly drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected along with all cleanup debris into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XCF contacted ERTS to report a one-cup spill of regulated UN2796 "Sulfuric Acid 50%" (sulfuric acid, with not more than 51% acid) that was released inside trailer #4635376 due to the drums not being properly sealed. ERTS dispatched contractors to assess. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor. The contractor advised that two drums of product got pressured up and the caps have resealing pressure relief devices which caused the product to leak out. Both caps had resealed themselves and were no longer leaking when crews arrived. The released area and drums were neutralized and the drums wiped down. The area in the trailer was cleaned with absorbents. All absorbent waste was containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090601
item.description:
Report E-2022090601

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-29T21:08:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-12
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1750 ET, XPO Logistics reported a spill that occurred inside a trailer at the XPO terminal in XDM in Des Moines, IA. The spill consisted of a 330 gallon metal tote of UN1992 Corr12525b, which was damaged prior to arrival at the terminal due to improper loading which caused the tote to be slightly punctured by loose debris inside the trailer, causing a gallon to release. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 1120 ET, EnviroServe arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 gallons of product released to a 3' x 2' area of the trailer floor. The product left in the damaged tote was pumped out into a 275 gallon poly tote and one 40 gallon closed top poly drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and collected. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: 1. SequenceEvent: Hazardous package was discovered upon unloading the trailer. The package had been loaded on its side on top of two other large packages that were leaked on by this hazmat package. The incident was immediately brought to QA's attention and the hazmat package and all affected packages were put into a plastic lined tote and taken to a secure location away from other packages. It did not appear that any excess liquid from the leak had spread to any other part of the trailer. DescribePack: Caps on inner packaging were loose, allowing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Affected packages were segregated and placed into plastic lines totes. 2. X-2022081458: SequenceEvent: QA was informed about leaking hazmat in trailer. Leaking hazmat was placed into plastic line tote. Package was segregated from other packages and inspected by QA. Upon inspection discovered one of jugs caps caused a leak due to loose caps. DescribePack: Package had 4 jugs with one loose cap. Each jug was 1 gallons and location was found in a trailer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a plastic tote and segregated from other packages.

  • Description: On 07/19/2022 at approximately 1415, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3729714 at the station location in Des Moines, reporting an undeclared aerosol spill. The shipment consisted of 3 cans of Lysol aerosol spray and numerous bottles of hand sanitizer and antibacterial wipes. The aerosol canister unintentionally discharged due to the cap coming off and the contents shifting in the box. This shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations. The shipment is being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report I-2022090310
item.description:
Report I-2022090310

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-13
  • City: Des Moines

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the PM sort operations at the FedEx Express sort facility in Des Moines, IA a fiberboard box was observed to potentially contain undeclared DG. Further investigation indicated the box contained AFFIANCE FUNGICIDE, which per the SDS is fully regulated as UN3082 Environmentally hazardous substances, liquid, n.o.s. technical name azoxystrobin, Tetraconazole PGIII. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. The involved package is being held pending further disposition.

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Part of a two piece shipment, package was brought to the attention of management and DG at our station in Des Moines IA. Package was recognized has having been shipped and rejected previously which GHS labels on the package indicating that it might contain dangerous goods. Packages were offered to the station again with the GHS labels removed to which it was decided to inspect the contents of the packages. Inspection found each fibreboard box contained a 5 gallon bucket each containing ADF New PWC. There are corrosive GHS labels on the buckets nd each travelled with an SDS which shows product is listed as a UN 3253, Disodium Triosilicate,Class 8. There were no markings nor labels on the outside of the package to indicate there may be a hazardous material inside. There was no spillage from the packages Packages have been placed on hold at the location pending investigation C

  • Description: At 0653 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XCF) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture approximately 2 cups of Acetone(Hazardous - UN1090) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor and had dried. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged pail were placed into a 20 gallon poly drum and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
